verses.verse: Jacob <S%H3290><s%> lived <S%H3427><s%> in the land <S%H776><s%> of his father <S%H1><s%>'s travels, <S%H4033><s%> in the land <S%H776><s%> of Canaan. <S%H3667><s%>

This is the history <S%H8435><s%> of the generations <S%H8435><s%> of Jacob. <S%H3290><s%> Joseph, <S%H3130><s%> being seventeen <S%H6240><s%> years <S%H8141><s%> old, <S%H1121><s%> was feeding <S%H7462><s%> the flock <S%H6629><s%> with his brothers. <S%H251><s%> He was a boy <S%H5288><s%> with the sons <S%H1121><s%> of Bilhah <S%H1090><s%> and Zilpah, <S%H2153><s%> his father <S%H1><s%>'s wives. <S%H802><s%> Joseph <S%H3130><s%> brought <S%H935><s%> an evil <S%H7451><s%> report <S%H1681><s%> of them to their father. <S%H1><s%>

Now Israel <S%H3478><s%> loved <S%H157><s%> Joseph <S%H3130><s%> more than all his children, <S%H1121><s%> because he was the son <S%H1121><s%> of his old age, <S%H2208><s%> and he made <S%H6213><s%> him a coat <S%H3801><s%> of many colors. <S%H6446><s%>

His brothers <S%H251><s%> saw <S%H7200><s%> that their father <S%H1><s%> loved <S%H157><s%> him more than all his brothers, <S%H251><s%> and they hated <S%H8130><s%> him, <S%H3201><s%> and couldn't speak <S%H1696><s%> peaceably to him. <S%H7965><s%>
Joseph <S%H3130><s%> dreamed <S%H2492><s%> a dream, <S%H2472><s%> and he told <S%H5046><s%> it to his brothers, <S%H251><s%> and they hated <S%H8130><s%> him all the more. <S%H3254><s%>
He said <S%H559><s%> to them, <S%H8085><s%> "Please hear this dream <S%H2472><s%> which I have dreamed: <S%H2492><s%>

for behold, <S%H481><s%> we were binding sheaves <S%H485><s%> in the field, <S%H7704><s%> and behold, <S%H485><s%> my sheaf arose <S%H6965><s%> and also stood upright; <S%H5324><s%> and behold, <S%H485><s%> your sheaves came around, <S%H5437><s%> and bowed <S%H7812><s%> down to my sheaf. <S%H485><s%>"

His brothers <S%H251><s%> said <S%H559><s%> to him, <S%H4427><s%> "Will you indeed reign <S%H4427><s%> over us? <S%H4910><s%> Or will you indeed have dominion <S%H4910><s%> over us? <S%H8130><s%>" They hated him all the more <S%H3254><s%> for his dreams <S%H2472><s%> and for his words. <S%H1697><s%>

He dreamed <S%H2492><s%> yet another <S%H312><s%> dream, <S%H2472><s%> and told <S%H5608><s%> it to his brothers, <S%H251><s%> and said, <S%H559><s%> "Behold, <S%H2492><s%> I have dreamed yet another dream: <S%H2472><s%> and behold, <S%H8121><s%> the sun and the moon <S%H3394><s%> and eleven <S%H6240><s%> stars <S%H3556><s%> bowed down to me. <S%H7812><s%>"

He told <S%H5608><s%> it to his father <S%H1><s%> and to his brothers. <S%H251><s%> His father <S%H1><s%> rebuked <S%H1605><s%> him, <S%H559><s%> and said to him, <S%H2472><s%> "What is this dream that you have dreamed? <S%H2492><s%> Will I and your mother <S%H517><s%> and your brothers <S%H251><s%> indeed <S%H935><s%> come <S%H935><s%> to bow ourselves down <S%H7812><s%> to you to the earth? <S%H776><s%>"
His brothers <S%H251><s%> envied <S%H7065><s%> him, <S%H1><s%> but his father kept this saying <S%H1697><s%> in mind. <S%H8104><s%>
His brothers <S%H251><s%> went <S%H3212><s%> to feed <S%H7462><s%> their father <S%H1><s%>'s flock <S%H6629><s%> in Shechem. <S%H7927><s%>

Israel <S%H3478><s%> said <S%H559><s%> to Joseph, <S%H3130><s%> "Aren't <S%H251><s%> your brothers feeding <S%H7462><s%> the flock in Shechem? <S%H7927><s%> Come, <S%H3212><s%> and I will send you <S%H7971><s%> to them. <S%H559><s%>" He said to him, "Here I am."

He said <S%H559><s%> to him, <S%H3212><s%> "Go now, <S%H7200><s%> see whether it is well <S%H7965><s%> with your brothers, <S%H251><s%> and well <S%H7965><s%> with the flock; <S%H6629><s%> and bring <S%H7725><s%> me word <S%H1697><s%> again. <S%H7725><s%>" So he sent <S%H7971><s%> him out of the valley <S%H6010><s%> of Hebron, <S%H2275><s%> and he came <S%H935><s%> to Shechem. <S%H7927><s%>

A certain man <S%H376><s%> found him, <S%H4672><s%> and behold, <S%H8582><s%> he was wandering in the field. <S%H7704><s%> The man <S%H376><s%> asked him, <S%H7592><s%> "What <S%H559><s%> are you looking for? <S%H1245><s%>"
He said, <S%H559><s%> "I am looking <S%H1245><s%> for my brothers. <S%H251><s%> Tell <S%H5046><s%> me, <S%H375><s%> please, where they are feeding the flock. <S%H7462><s%>"

The man <S%H376><s%> said, <S%H559><s%> "They have left <S%H5265><s%> here, <S%H2088><s%> for I heard <S%H8085><s%> them say, <S%H559><s%> <S%H3212><s%> 'Let us go to Dothan. <S%H1886><s%>'" Joseph <S%H3130><s%> went <S%H3212><s%> after <S%H310><s%> his brothers, <S%H251><s%> and found <S%H4672><s%> them in Dothan. <S%H1886><s%>
They saw <S%H7200><s%> him afar off, <S%H7350><s%> and before he came near <S%H7126><s%> to them, <S%H5230><s%> they conspired against him to kill him. <S%H4191><s%>
They said <S%H559><s%> one <S%H376><s%> to another, <S%H251><s%> "Behold, <S%H1976><s%> this dreamer <S%H1167><s%> comes. <S%H935><s%>

Come <S%H3212><s%> now therefore, <S%H2026><s%> and let's kill him, <S%H7993><s%> and cast him into one <S%H259><s%> of the pits, <S%H953><s%> and we will say, <S%H559><s%> <S%H7451><s%> 'An evil animal <S%H2416><s%> has devoured <S%H398><s%> him. <S%H7200><s%>' We will see what will become of his dreams. <S%H2472><s%>"
Reuben <S%H7205><s%> heard <S%H8085><s%> it, <S%H5337><s%> and delivered him out of their hand, <S%H559><s%> and said, "Let <S%H559><s%>'s not take his life. <S%H5221><s%>"

Reuben <S%H7205><s%> said <S%H559><s%> to them, <S%H8210><s%> "Shed no blood. <S%H1818><s%> Throw <S%H7993><s%> him into this pit <S%H953><s%> that is in the wilderness, <S%H4057><s%> but lay <S%H7971><s%> no hand <S%H3027><s%> on him <S%H5337><s%>" â€”that he might deliver him out of their hand, <S%H3027><s%> to restore <S%H7725><s%> him to <S%H7725><s%> his father. <S%H1><s%>

It happened, <S%H3947><s%> when Joseph came to <S%H7993><s%> his brothers, <S%H953><s%> that they stripped Joseph <S%H953><s%> of his <S%H7386><s%> coat, <S%H4325><s%> the coat of many colors that was on him;
and they took <S%H3947><s%> him, <S%H7993><s%> and threw him into the pit. <S%H953><s%> The pit <S%H953><s%> was empty. <S%H7386><s%> There was no water in it. <S%H4325><s%>

They sat down <S%H3427><s%> to eat <S%H398><s%> bread, <S%H3899><s%> and they lifted up <S%H5375><s%> their eyes <S%H5869><s%> and looked, <S%H7200><s%> and saw a caravan <S%H736><s%> of Ishmaelites <S%H3459><s%> was coming <S%H935><s%> from Gilead, <S%H1568><s%> with their camels <S%H1581><s%> bearing <S%H5375><s%> spices <S%H5219><s%> and balm <S%H6875><s%> and myrrh, <S%H3910><s%> going <S%H1980><s%> to carry it down <S%H3381><s%> to Egypt. <S%H4714><s%>

Judah <S%H3063><s%> said <S%H559><s%> to his brothers, <S%H251><s%> "What profit <S%H1215><s%> is it if we kill <S%H2026><s%> our brother <S%H251><s%> and conceal <S%H3680><s%> his blood? <S%H1818><s%>

Come, <S%H3212><s%> and let <S%H4376><s%>'s sell him to the Ishmaelites, <S%H3459><s%> and not let our hand <S%H3027><s%> be on him; <S%H251><s%> for he is our brother, our flesh. <S%H1320><s%>" His brothers <S%H251><s%> listened to him. <S%H8085><s%>

Midianites <S%H4084><s%> who were merchants <S%H582><s%> passed <S%H5674><s%> by, <S%H4900><s%> and they drew and lifted up <S%H5927><s%> Joseph <S%H3130><s%> out of the pit, <S%H953><s%> and sold <S%H4376><s%> Joseph <S%H3130><s%> to the Ishmaelites <S%H3459><s%> for twenty <S%H6242><s%> pieces of silver. <S%H3701><s%> They brought <S%H935><s%> Joseph <S%H3130><s%> into Egypt. <S%H4714><s%>
Reuben <S%H7205><s%> returned <S%H7725><s%> to the pit; <S%H953><s%> and saw that Joseph <S%H3130><s%> wasn't <S%H953><s%> in the pit; and he tore <S%H7167><s%> his clothes. <S%H899><s%>
He returned <S%H7725><s%> to his brothers, <S%H251><s%> and said, <S%H559><s%> "The child <S%H3206><s%> is no more; <S%H575><s%> and I, where will I go? <S%H935><s%>"

They took <S%H3947><s%> Joseph <S%H3130><s%>'s coat, <S%H3801><s%> and killed <S%H7819><s%> a male <S%H8163><s%> goat, <S%H5795><s%> and dipped <S%H2881><s%> the coat <S%H3801><s%> in the blood. <S%H1818><s%>

They took <S%H7971><s%> the coat <S%H3801><s%> of many colors, <S%H6446><s%> and they brought <S%H935><s%> it to their father, <S%H1><s%> and said, <S%H559><s%> "We have found <S%H4672><s%> this. <S%H5234><s%> Examine it, <S%H1121><s%> now, whether it is your son's coat or not. <S%H3801><s%>"

He recognized it, <S%H5234><s%> and said, <S%H559><s%> "It is my son <S%H1121><s%>'s coat. <S%H3801><s%> An evil <S%H7451><s%> animal <S%H2416><s%> has devoured <S%H398><s%> him. <S%H3130><s%> Joseph is without doubt <S%H2963><s%> torn in pieces. <S%H2963><s%>"

Jacob <S%H3290><s%> tore <S%H7167><s%> his clothes, <S%H8071><s%> and put <S%H7760><s%> sackcloth <S%H8242><s%> on his waist, <S%H4975><s%> and mourned <S%H56><s%> for his son <S%H1121><s%> many <S%H7227><s%> days. <S%H3117><s%>

All his sons <S%H1121><s%> and all his daughters <S%H1323><s%> rose up <S%H6965><s%> to comfort <S%H5162><s%> him, <S%H3985><s%> but he refused to be comforted. <S%H5162><s%> He said, <S%H559><s%> "For I will go down <S%H3381><s%> to Sheol <S%H7585><s%> to my son <S%H1121><s%> mourning. <S%H57><s%>" His father <S%H1><s%> wept for him. <S%H1058><s%>

The Midianites <S%H4092><s%> sold <S%H4376><s%> him into Egypt <S%H4714><s%> to Potiphar, <S%H6318><s%> an officer <S%H5631><s%> of Pharaoh <S%H6547><s%>'s, the captain <S%H8269><s%> of the guard. <S%H2876><s%>
